content:
TITLE: Adding dependencies for Flutter Chat UI
DESCRIPTION: Adds flutter_chat_core and flutter_chat_ui as dependencies in the pubspec.yaml file. This is required to install the Flyer Chat UI package and its core dependencies into a Flutter project. Use the latest version of flutter_chat_core and at least version 2.0.0 of flutter_chat_ui.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
dependencies:
  flutter_chat_core: ^ # Use the latest version
  flutter_chat_ui: ^2.0.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding dependencies to pubspec.yaml in Flutter
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to add the necessary dependencies (`flutter_chat_core` and `flutter_chat_ui`) to your `pubspec.yaml` file. This is the first step in installing the Flyer Chat UI package. Make sure to use the latest version of `flutter_chat_core` and at least version 2.0.0 of `flutter_chat_ui`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/flutter_chat_ui/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
dependencies:
  flutter_chat_core: ^ # Use the latest version
  flutter_chat_ui: ^2.0.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Cross Cache Package in Flutter
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for adding the Cross Cache package to your Flutter project's pubspec.yaml file. This snippet shows how to declare the dependency in your project configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/cross_cache/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
dependencies:
  cross_cache: ^ # Use the latest version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Flutter Chat Core and UI Packages in pubspec.yaml
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for adding both flutter_chat_core and flutter_chat_ui packages to a Flutter project's dependencies in the pubspec.yaml file. This shows how to specify the package versions needed for implementing the Flyer Chat UI system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/flutter_chat_core/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
dependencies:
  flutter_chat_core: ^ # Use the latest version
  flutter_chat_ui: ^2.0.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Direct Cache Access Methods in Dart
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates direct interaction with the cache through methods like contains, set, get, delete, and updateKey. This shows how to check for existing items, manually add data, retrieve cached content, and manage cache entries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/cross_cache/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
// Check if an item exists
bool exists = await cache.contains('my_unique_key');

// Manually add data
Uint8List myData = Uint8List.fromList([1, 2, 3]);
await cache.set('my_unique_key', myData);

// Retrieve data
try {
  Uint8List cachedData = await cache.get('my_unique_key');
  // Use cachedData
} catch (e) {
  print('Key not found or error: $e');
}

// Delete data
await cache.delete('my_unique_key');

// Rename cache key
// await cache.updateKey('old_key', 'new_key');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Cross Cache in Dart
DESCRIPTION: Creates instances of CrossCache with both basic initialization and with a custom Dio instance. Also includes a reminder to dispose the cache when it's no longer needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/cross_cache/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
import 'package:cross_cache/cross_cache.dart';
import 'package:dio/dio.dart';

// Basic initialization
final cache = CrossCache();

// Or with a custom Dio instance
final dio = Dio(/* your custom options */);
final customCache = CrossCache(dio: dio);

// Remember to dispose when done (e.g., in your State's dispose method)
// cache.dispose();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading and Caching Resources with CrossCache
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to fetch and cache resources from various sources including URLs, assets, data URIs, local files, and base64 strings using the downloadAndSave method. Includes handling for headers and download progress.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/cross_cache/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
Future<void> loadImageData(String imageUrl) async {
  try {
    final Uint8List imageData = await cache.downloadAndSave(
      imageUrl,
      headers: {'Authorization': 'Bearer YOUR_TOKEN'}, // Optional headers
      onReceiveProgress: (cumulative, total) {
        print('Download progress: ${cumulative / total * 100}%'); // Optional progress
      },
    );
    // Use imageData (e.g., display with Image.memory)
    print('Image loaded, ${imageData.lengthInBytes} bytes');
  } catch (e) {
    print('Error loading image: $e');
  }
}

// Examples of different sources:
// await loadImageData('https://example.com/image.jpg');
// await loadImageData('assets/my_icon.png');
// await loadImageData('data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUA...');
// await loadImageData('/path/to/local/file.jpg'); // IO only
// await loadImageData('iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUA...'); // Base64 string
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Custom Message Builder in Flutter Chat UI
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to use the customMessageBuilder provided by the flutter_chat_ui package to render custom message widgets. The example shows a minimal implementation that returns an empty SizedBox.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/flyer_chat_custom_message/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
import 'package:flutter_chat_ui/flutter_chat_ui.dart';

Chat(
  builders: Builders(
    customMessageBuilder: (context, message, index) =>
      const SizedBox.shrink(),
  ),
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using CachedNetworkImage in Flutter Widgets
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement CachedNetworkImage as a replacement for NetworkImage in a Flutter widget. Includes creating and disposing a CrossCache instance, handling loading states, and error handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/cross_cache/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:cross_cache/cross_cache.dart';

class MyWidget extends StatefulWidget {
  @override
  _MyWidgetState createState() => _MyWidgetState();
}

class _MyWidgetState extends State<MyWidget> {
  final _cache = CrossCache(); // Create an instance

  @override
  void dispose() {
    _cache.dispose(); // Dispose the cache
    super.dispose();
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Image(
      image: CachedNetworkImage(
        'https://example.com/image.jpg',
        _cache, // Pass the cache instance
        headers: {'Authorization': 'Bearer YOUR_TOKEN'}, // Optional headers
      ),
      loadingBuilder: (context, child, loadingProgress) {
        if (loadingProgress == null) return child;
        return Center(
          child: CircularProgressIndicator(
            value: loadingProgress.expectedTotalBytes != null
                ? loadingProgress.cumulativeBytesLoaded / loadingProgress.expectedTotalBytes!
                : null,
          ),
        );
      },
      errorBuilder: (context, error, stackTrace) => Icon(Icons.error),
    );
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing FlyerChatImageMessage Widget with flutter_chat_ui
DESCRIPTION: Example code showing how to integrate the FlyerChatImageMessage widget with the Chat component from flutter_chat_ui. The imageMessageBuilder is configured to use the FlyerChatImageMessage component for rendering image messages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/flyer_chat_image_message/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
import 'package:flutter_chat_ui/flutter_chat_ui.dart';
import 'package:flyer_chat_image_message/flyer_chat_image_message.dart';

Chat(
    builders: Builders(
        imageMessageBuilder: (context, message, index) =>
            FlyerChatImageMessage(message: message, index: index),
    ),
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing FlyerChatTextMessage in Flutter
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to use the FlyerChatTextMessage widget within a Chat component from flutter_chat_ui. It shows the basic setup for integrating the custom text message widget into a chat interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/flyer_chat_text_message/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
import 'package:flutter_chat_ui/flutter_chat_ui.dart';
import 'package:flyer_chat_text_message/flyer_chat_text_message.dart';

Chat(
    builders: Builders(
        textMessageBuilder: (context, message, index) =>
            FlyerChatTextMessage(message: message, index: index),
    ),
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing FlyerChatFileMessage in Flutter Chat UI
DESCRIPTION: This Dart code demonstrates how to use the FlyerChatFileMessage widget within the Chat widget from flutter_chat_ui. It shows the integration of the file message builder into the Builders configuration of the Chat widget.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/flyer_chat_file_message/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
import 'package:flutter_chat_ui/flutter_chat_ui.dart';
import 'package:flyer_chat_file_message/flyer_chat_file_message.dart';

Chat(
    builders: Builders(
        fileMessageBuilder: (context, message, index) =>
            FlyerChatFileMessage(message: message, index: index),
    ),
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing System Message Builder in Dart
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to use the FlyerChatSystemMessage widget as a system message builder in a Chat widget. This code demonstrates proper integration with the flutter_chat_ui package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/flyer_chat_system_message/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
import 'package:flutter_chat_ui/flutter_chat_ui.dart';
import 'package:flyer_chat_system_message/flyer_chat_system_message.dart';

Chat(
    builders: Builders(
        systemMessageBuilder: (context, message, index) =>
            FlyerChatSystemMessage(message: message, index: index),
    ),
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing flyer_chat_file_message package in Flutter
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows how to add the flyer_chat_file_message package to the pubspec.yaml file alongside flutter_chat_ui. It specifies the dependencies required for using the file message widget in a Flutter project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/flyer_chat_file_message/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
dependencies:
  flutter_chat_ui: ^2.0.0
  flyer_chat_file_message: ^ # Use the latest version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing flyer_chat_text_message in pubspec.yaml
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to add the flyer_chat_text_message package to the pubspec.yaml file alongside flutter_chat_ui. It specifies the dependencies required for using the text message widget in a Flutter project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/flyer_chat_text_message/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
dependencies:
  flutter_chat_ui: ^2.0.0
  flyer_chat_text_message: ^ # Use the latest version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Flyer Chat System Message package in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Add the flutter_chat_ui and flyer_chat_system_message packages to your pubspec.yaml dependencies. After adding these dependencies, run 'flutter pub get' to install them.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/packages/flyer_chat_system_message/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
dependencies:
  flutter_chat_ui: ^2.0.0
  flyer_chat_system_message: ^ # Use the latest version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Native Assets and Flutter Assets
DESCRIPTION: Configures the installation of native assets and Flutter assets into the application bundle. This ensures all required resources are available to the application at runtime.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Copy the native assets provided by the build.dart from all packages.
set(NATIVE_ASSETS_DIR "${PROJECT_BUILD_DIR}native_assets/linux/")
install(DIRECTORY "${NATIVE_ASSETS_DIR}"
   DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_LIB_DIR}"
   COMPONENT Runtime)

# Fully re-copy the assets directory on each build to avoid having stale files
# from a previous install.
set(FLUTTER_ASSET_DIR_NAME "flutter_assets")
install(CODE "
  file(REMOVE_RECURSE \"${INSTALL_BUNDLE_DATA_DIR}/${FLUTTER_ASSET_DIR_NAME}\")
  " COMPONENT Runtime)
install(DIRECTORY "${PROJECT_BUILD_DIR}/${FLUTTER_ASSET_DIR_NAME}"
  DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_DATA_DIR}" COMPONENT Runtime)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Installation Rules for Windows Application
DESCRIPTION: Sets up installation rules for the Windows application, placing executable, data, libraries, and assets in the correct locations. Handles ICU data, Flutter library, bundled plugin libraries, and native assets for proper deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/windows/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# === Installation ===
# Support files are copied into place next to the executable, so that it can
# run in place. This is done instead of making a separate bundle (as on Linux)
# so that building and running from within Visual Studio will work.
set(BUILD_BUNDLE_DIR "$<TARGET_FILE_DIR:${BINARY_NAME}>")
# Make the "install" step default, as it's required to run.
set(CMAKE_VS_INCLUDE_INSTALL_TO_DEFAULT_BUILD 1)
if(CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX_INITIALIZED_TO_DEFAULT)
  set(CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX "${BUILD_BUNDLE_DIR}" CACHE PATH "..." FORCE)
endif()

set(INSTALL_BUNDLE_DATA_DIR "${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}/data")
set(INSTALL_BUNDLE_LIB_DIR "${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}")

install(TARGETS ${BINARY_NAME} RUNTIME DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}"
  COMPONENT Runtime)

install(FILES "${FLUTTER_ICU_DATA_FILE}" DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_DATA_DIR}"
  COMPONENT Runtime)

install(FILES "${FLUTTER_LIBRARY}" DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_LIB_DIR}"
  COMPONENT Runtime)

if(PLUGIN_BUNDLED_LIBRARIES)
  install(FILES "${PLUGIN_BUNDLED_LIBRARIES}"
    DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_LIB_DIR}"
    COMPONENT Runtime)
endif()

# Copy the native assets provided by the build.dart from all packages.
set(NATIVE_ASSETS_DIR "${PROJECT_BUILD_DIR}native_assets/windows/")
install(DIRECTORY "${NATIVE_ASSETS_DIR}"
   DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_LIB_DIR}"
   COMPONENT Runtime)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Linux Build for Flutter Chat UI Application with CMake
DESCRIPTION: This CMake script defines the build configuration for the Linux version of a Flutter Chat UI application. It creates an executable target with the binary name specified in the top-level CMakeLists.txt, includes necessary source files, applies standard build settings, adds preprocessor definitions, and links required libraries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/runner/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: cmake
CODE:
```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13)
project(runner LANGUAGES CXX)

# Define the application target. To change its name, change BINARY_NAME in the
# top-level CMakeLists.txt, not the value here, or `flutter run` will no longer
# work.
#
# Any new source files that you add to the application should be added here.
add_executable(${BINARY_NAME}
  "main.cc"
  "my_application.cc"
  "${FLUTTER_MANAGED_DIR}/generated_plugin_registrant.cc"
)

# Apply the standard set of build settings. This can be removed for applications
# that need different build settings.
apply_standard_settings(${BINARY_NAME})

# Add preprocessor definitions for the application ID.
add_definitions(-DAPPLICATION_ID="${APPLICATION_ID}")

# Add dependency libraries. Add any application-specific dependencies here.
target_link_libraries(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE flutter)
target_link_libraries(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE PkgConfig::GTK)

target_include_directories(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE "${CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR}")

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Application Components
DESCRIPTION: Configures the installation of application components including the binary, ICU data, Flutter library, and bundled libraries. This ensures all necessary files are correctly placed in the application bundle.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
install(TARGETS ${BINARY_NAME} RUNTIME DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}"
  COMPONENT Runtime)

install(FILES "${FLUTTER_ICU_DATA_FILE}" DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_DATA_DIR}"
  COMPONENT Runtime)

install(FILES "${FLUTTER_LIBRARY}" DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_LIB_DIR}"
  COMPONENT Runtime)

foreach(bundled_library ${PLUGIN_BUNDLED_LIBRARIES})
  install(FILES "${bundled_library}"
    DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_LIB_DIR}"
    COMPONENT Runtime)
endforeach(bundled_library)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including Flutter and Application Build Components
DESCRIPTION: Sets up the Flutter managed directory and includes necessary subdirectories for the Flutter library, application runner, and plugins. These components are essential for building the Flutter application within the CMake system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/windows/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Flutter library and tool build rules.
set(FLUTTER_MANAGED_DIR "${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}/flutter")
add_subdirectory(${FLUTTER_MANAGED_DIR})

# Application build; see runner/CMakeLists.txt.
add_subdirectory("runner")


# Generated plugin build rules, which manage building the plugins and adding
# them to the application.
include(flutter/generated_plugins.cmake)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Applying Standard Compilation Settings
DESCRIPTION: Defines a function to apply standard compilation settings to targets including C++14 support, compiler warnings, and optimization flags. This ensures consistent build settings across different parts of the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Compilation settings that should be applied to most targets.
#
# Be cautious about adding new options here, as plugins use this function by
# default. In most cases, you should add new options to specific targets instead
# of modifying this function.
function(APPLY_STANDARD_SETTINGS TARGET)
  target_compile_features(${TARGET} PUBLIC cxx_std_14)
  target_compile_options(${TARGET} PRIVATE -Wall -Werror)
  target_compile_options(${TARGET} PRIVATE "$<$<NOT:$<CONFIG:Debug>>:-O3>")
  target_compile_definitions(${TARGET} PRIVATE "$<$<NOT:$<CONFIG:Debug>>:NDEBUG>")
endfunction()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linking Dependencies for Flutter Windows Application
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the libraries to link with the Windows executable and sets include directories. This links the Flutter engine and required Windows libraries like dwmapi.lib, which is needed for desktop window management functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/windows/runner/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
target_link_libraries(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE flutter flutter_wrapper_app)
target_link_libraries(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE "dwmapi.lib")
target_include_directories(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE "${CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR}")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting CMake Policies and Installation Paths
DESCRIPTION: Configures CMake policies and installation-related paths for the Flutter Linux application. This includes setting the runtime path to allow loading bundled libraries and configuring cross-building options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Explicitly opt in to modern CMake behaviors to avoid warnings with recent
# versions of CMake.
cmake_policy(SET CMP0063 NEW)

# Load bundled libraries from the lib/ directory relative to the binary.
set(CMAKE_INSTALL_RPATH "$ORIGIN/lib")

# Root filesystem for cross-building.
if(FLUTTER_TARGET_PLATFORM_SYSROOT)
  set(CMAKE_SYSROOT ${FLUTTER_TARGET_PLATFORM_SYSROOT})
  set(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH ${CMAKE_SYSROOT})
  set(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_PROGRAM NEVER)
  set(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_PACKAGE ONLY)
  set(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_LIBRARY ONLY)
  set(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_INCLUDE ONLY)
endif()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Flutter and System Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Configures the Flutter library and tool build rules, and sets up system-level dependencies like GTK. This section integrates the Flutter engine with the native Linux build process and ensures required Linux libraries are available.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Flutter library and tool build rules.
set(FLUTTER_MANAGED_DIR "${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}/flutter")
add_subdirectory(${FLUTTER_MANAGED_DIR})

# System-level dependencies.
find_package(PkgConfig REQUIRED)
pkg_check_modules(GTK REQUIRED IMPORTED_TARGET gtk+-3.0)

# Application build; see runner/CMakeLists.txt.
add_subdirectory("runner")

# Run the Flutter tool portions of the build. This must not be removed.
add_dependencies(${BINARY_NAME} flutter_assemble)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Standard Compilation Settings Function in CMake
DESCRIPTION: Creates a function to apply standard C++ compilation settings to targets. Sets C++17 standard, warning levels, exception handling, and debug definitions which will be used by project targets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/windows/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Compilation settings that should be applied to most targets.
#
# Be cautious about adding new options here, as plugins use this function by
# default. In most cases, you should add new options to specific targets instead
# of modifying this function.
function(APPLY_STANDARD_SETTINGS TARGET)
  target_compile_features(${TARGET} PUBLIC cxx_std_17)
  target_compile_options(${TARGET} PRIVATE /W4 /WX /wd"4100")
  target_compile_options(${TARGET} PRIVATE /EHsc)
  target_compile_definitions(${TARGET} PRIVATE "_HAS_EXCEPTIONS=0")
  target_compile_definitions(${TARGET} PRIVATE "$<$<CONFIG:Debug>:_DEBUG>")
endfunction()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Flutter Library Dependencies Configuration in CMake
DESCRIPTION: Sets up the system-level dependencies required for the Flutter Linux application using pkg-config. It configures GTK, GLIB, and GIO as required imported targets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/flutter/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# === Flutter Library ===
# System-level dependencies.
find_package(PkgConfig REQUIRED)
pkg_check_modules(GTK REQUIRED IMPORTED_TARGET gtk+-3.0)
pkg_check_modules(GLIB REQUIRED IMPORTED_TARGET glib-2.0)
pkg_check_modules(GIO REQUIRED IMPORTED_TARGET gio-2.0)

set(FLUTTER_LIBRARY "${EPHEMERAL_DIR}/libflutter_linux_gtk.so")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Output Directory Structure
DESCRIPTION: Sets target properties to ensure the executable is placed in the correct intermediate directory. This prevents users from running unbundled copies that wouldn't have the correct relative resource paths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Only the install-generated bundle's copy of the executable will launch
# correctly, since the resources must in the right relative locations. To avoid
# people trying to run the unbundled copy, put it in a subdirectory instead of
# the default top-level location.
set_target_properties(${BINARY_NAME}
  PROPERTIES
  RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY "${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/intermediates_do_not_run"
)


# Generated plugin build rules, which manage building the plugins and adding
# them to the application.
include(flutter/generated_plugins.cmake)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling Windows Macros That Conflict with C++ Standard Library
DESCRIPTION: Disables the Windows NOMINMAX macro which can conflict with C++ standard library functions. This prevents potential naming collisions between Windows-specific macros and standard C++ functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/windows/runner/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
target_compile_definitions(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE "NOMINMAX")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Version Compiler Definitions for Flutter Windows Build
DESCRIPTION: Adds preprocessor definitions for the Flutter version information. These definitions make version information available to the code at compile-time, allowing the application to access its own version details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/windows/runner/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
target_compile_definitions(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE "FLUTTER_VERSION=\"${FLUTTER_VERSION}\"")
target_compile_definitions(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE "FLUTTER_VERSION_MAJOR=${FLUTTER_VERSION_MAJOR}")
target_compile_definitions(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE "FLUTTER_VERSION_MINOR=${FLUTTER_VERSION_MINOR}")
target_compile_definitions(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE "FLUTTER_VERSION_PATCH=${FLUTTER_VERSION_PATCH}")
target_compile_definitions(${BINARY_NAME} PRIVATE "FLUTTER_VERSION_BUILD=${FLUTTER_VERSION_BUILD}")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Flutter Library Headers Configuration in CMake
DESCRIPTION: Configures the Flutter library headers by creating a list of header files and prepending the ephemeral directory path to each. Sets up a Flutter interface library with appropriate include directories and dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/flutter/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
list(APPEND FLUTTER_LIBRARY_HEADERS
  "fl_basic_message_channel.h"
  "fl_binary_codec.h"
  "fl_binary_messenger.h"
  "fl_dart_project.h"
  "fl_engine.h"
  "fl_json_message_codec.h"
  "fl_json_method_codec.h"
  "fl_message_codec.h"
  "fl_method_call.h"
  "fl_method_channel.h"
  "fl_method_codec.h"
  "fl_method_response.h"
  "fl_plugin_registrar.h"
  "fl_plugin_registry.h"
  "fl_standard_message_codec.h"
  "fl_standard_method_codec.h"
  "fl_string_codec.h"
  "fl_value.h"
  "fl_view.h"
  "flutter_linux.h"
)
list_prepend(FLUTTER_LIBRARY_HEADERS "${EPHEMERAL_DIR}/flutter_linux/")
add_library(flutter INTERFACE)
target_include_directories(flutter INTERFACE
  "${EPHEMERAL_DIR}"
)
target_link_libraries(flutter INTERFACE "${FLUTTER_LIBRARY}")
target_link_libraries(flutter INTERFACE
  PkgConfig::GTK
  PkgConfig::GLIB
  PkgConfig::GIO
)
add_dependencies(flutter flutter_assemble)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Flutter Tool Backend Integration with CMake
DESCRIPTION: Sets up a custom command to run the Flutter tool backend script which generates the necessary Flutter library and headers. Uses a phony output to ensure the command runs on every build.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/flutter/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# === Flutter tool backend ===
# _phony_ is a non-existent file to force this command to run every time,
# since currently there's no way to get a full input/output list from the
# flutter tool.
add_custom_command(
  OUTPUT ${FLUTTER_LIBRARY} ${FLUTTER_LIBRARY_HEADERS}
    ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/_phony_
  COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} -E env
    ${FLUTTER_TOOL_ENVIRONMENT}
    "${FLUTTER_ROOT}/packages/flutter_tools/bin/tool_backend.sh"
      ${FLUTTER_TARGET_PLATFORM} ${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE}
  VERBATIM
)
add_custom_target(flutter_assemble DEPENDS
  "${FLUTTER_LIBRARY}"
  ${FLUTTER_LIBRARY_HEADERS}
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: List Prepend Function Implementation in CMake
DESCRIPTION: A custom function that prepends a prefix to each element in a list. This serves the same purpose as list(TRANSFORM ... PREPEND ...) which isn't available in CMake 3.10.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/flutter/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
function(list_prepend LIST_NAME PREFIX)
    set(NEW_LIST "")
    foreach(element ${${LIST_NAME}})
        list(APPEND NEW_LIST "${PREFIX}${element}")
    endforeach(element)
    set(${LIST_NAME} "${NEW_LIST}" PARENT_SCOPE)
endfunction()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Managing Flutter Assets Installation
DESCRIPTION: Configures the handling of Flutter assets, ensuring they are correctly copied to the installation directory. This includes cleaning previous assets and installing the AOT library for non-Debug builds to optimize performance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/windows/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Fully re-copy the assets directory on each build to avoid having stale files
# from a previous install.
set(FLUTTER_ASSET_DIR_NAME "flutter_assets")
install(CODE "
  file(REMOVE_RECURSE \"${INSTALL_BUNDLE_DATA_DIR}/${FLUTTER_ASSET_DIR_NAME}\")
  " COMPONENT Runtime)
install(DIRECTORY "${PROJECT_BUILD_DIR}/${FLUTTER_ASSET_DIR_NAME}"
  DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_DATA_DIR}" COMPONENT Runtime)

# Install the AOT library on non-Debug builds only.
install(FILES "${AOT_LIBRARY}" DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_DATA_DIR}"
  CONFIGURATIONS Profile;Release
  COMPONENT Runtime)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Project and Build Configuration in CMake
DESCRIPTION: Initializes the CMake project, sets the executable name, and configures build options for Debug, Profile, and Release modes. Defines compiler behavior and Unicode support for Windows.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/windows/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Project-level configuration.
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.14)
project(flyer_chat LANGUAGES CXX)

# The name of the executable created for the application. Change this to change
# the on-disk name of your application.
set(BINARY_NAME "flyer_chat")

# Explicitly opt in to modern CMake behaviors to avoid warnings with recent
# versions of CMake.
cmake_policy(VERSION 3.14...3.25)

# Define build configuration option.
get_property(IS_MULTICONFIG GLOBAL PROPERTY GENERATOR_IS_MULTI_CONFIG)
if(IS_MULTICONFIG)
  set(CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES "Debug;Profile;Release"
    CACHE STRING "" FORCE)
else()
  if(NOT CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE AND NOT CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES)
    set(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE "Debug" CACHE
      STRING "Flutter build mode" FORCE)
    set_property(CACHE CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE PROPERTY STRINGS
      "Debug" "Profile" "Release")
  endif()
endif()
# Define settings for the Profile build mode.
set(CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_PROFILE "${CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_RELEASE}")
set(CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS_PROFILE "${CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS_RELEASE}")
set(CMAKE_C_FLAGS_PROFILE "${CMAKE_C_FLAGS_RELEASE}")
set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_PROFILE "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_RELEASE}")

# Use Unicode for all projects.
add_definitions(-DUNICODE -D_UNICODE)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Installation Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Configures the installation directories and bundle location for the application. This section defines where the built application and its resources will be placed in the final bundle structure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# === Installation ===
# By default, "installing" just makes a relocatable bundle in the build
# directory.
set(BUILD_BUNDLE_DIR "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/bundle")
if(CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX_INITIALIZED_TO_DEFAULT)
  set(CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX "${BUILD_BUNDLE_DIR}" CACHE PATH "..." FORCE)
endif()

# Start with a clean build bundle directory every time.
install(CODE "
  file(REMOVE_RECURSE \"${BUILD_BUNDLE_DIR}/\")
  " COMPONENT Runtime)

set(INSTALL_BUNDLE_DATA_DIR "${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}/data")
set(INSTALL_BUNDLE_LIB_DIR "${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}/lib")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Flutter Wrapper Libraries Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Sets up wrapper libraries for plugins and the main application, including source files and build settings for both plugin and app wrappers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/windows/flutter/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: cmake
CODE:
```
list(APPEND CPP_WRAPPER_SOURCES_CORE
  "core_implementations.cc"
  "standard_codec.cc"
)
list(TRANSFORM CPP_WRAPPER_SOURCES_CORE PREPEND "${WRAPPER_ROOT}/")
list(APPEND CPP_WRAPPER_SOURCES_PLUGIN
  "plugin_registrar.cc"
)
list(TRANSFORM CPP_WRAPPER_SOURCES_PLUGIN PREPEND "${WRAPPER_ROOT}/")
list(APPEND CPP_WRAPPER_SOURCES_APP
  "flutter_engine.cc"
  "flutter_view_controller.cc"
)
list(TRANSFORM CPP_WRAPPER_SOURCES_APP PREPEND "${WRAPPER_ROOT}/")
```

TITLE: Installing AOT Library for Release Builds
DESCRIPTION: Configures the installation of the Ahead-Of-Time (AOT) compiled library for non-Debug builds. AOT compilation improves performance in release builds by pre-compiling Dart code to native machine code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/linux/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
# Install the AOT library on non-Debug builds only.

  install(FILES "${AOT_LIBRARY}" DESTINATION "${INSTALL_BUNDLE_LIB_DIR}"
    COMPONENT Runtime)
endif()
```

TITLE: Flutter Windows Build Configuration Setup
DESCRIPTION: Primary CMake configuration file that controls Flutter Windows build process. Sets up core variables, paths, and Flutter library configuration including ICU data file and AOT library locations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flyerhq/flutter_chat_ui/blob/main/examples/flyer_chat/windows/flutter/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: cmake
CODE:
```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.14)

set(EPHEMERAL_DIR "${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}/ephemeral")

include(${EPHEMERAL_DIR}/generated_config.cmake)

set(WRAPPER_ROOT "${EPHEMERAL_DIR}/cpp_client_wrapper")

if (NOT DEFINED FLUTTER_TARGET_PLATFORM)
  set(FLUTTER_TARGET_PLATFORM "windows-x64")
endif()

set(FLUTTER_LIBRARY "${EPHEMERAL_DIR}/flutter_windows.dll")

set(FLUTTER_LIBRARY ${FLUTTER_LIBRARY} PARENT_SCOPE)
set(FLUTTER_ICU_DATA_FILE "${EPHEMERAL_DIR}/icudtl.dat" PARENT_SCOPE)
set(PROJECT_BUILD_DIR "${PROJECT_DIR}/build/" PARENT_SCOPE)
set(AOT_LIBRARY "${PROJECT_DIR}/build/windows/app.so" PARENT_SCOPE)
```
